message.content:
cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.DB, cs.CY, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it deals with matching advertisers with the most relevant users to optimize campaign performance. It may also belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category as it deals with utilizing multiple data sources to choose the set of users according to the advertisers' targeting criteria. Additionally, it may belong to the Databases (cs.DB) sub-category as it proposes a framework for assessing the quality of data sources in large scale. It may also belong to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category as it deals with anonymized or unavailable user-level information due to privacy reasons. Finally, it may belong to the Cybernetics (cs.CY) sub-category as it proposes methodologies for evaluating the similarity of a specific data source categorization to that of the ground truth.
